alert.note: Alert for Broome (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:48AM EST until further notice by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...New York... Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Conklin. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Extensive basement and first floor flooding develops on Woodcrest Way, especially north of Munson Avenue. Flooding also threatens homes along Route 7 in Conklin Center. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:16 AM EST Monday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.3 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST.
